website_summaries.verdict: A unique design that’s perfect for the city.
pros: Rather than vents, the Metro uses a radial tensioning system around the perimeter that can resist 55 mph gusts
Fiberglass ribs help keep it sturdy
The lack of pointed ends also makes it very user friendly in the city and in crowded places
cons: At 37", this is very compact, and only just enough to cover one person
It’s also much pricier than regular umbrellas

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is Useless without Customer Service Replying
customer_reviews.text: I loved my blunt umbrella until one day when one of the arms snapped in the rain. I spent the extra money to purchase a nice umbrella knowing that they had a 5 year warranty should anything happen. I sent an e-mail to customer service and have not heard anything back. I am very disappointed in the customer service and now have a $60 umbrella that is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Disappointing quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love the engineering and design of this umbrella, but the build quality is awful. Lots of loose threads, sloppy stitching, cheap materials...not what I expect for the premium price. Worse yet, this was an anniversary gift for my wife, who loves umbrellas, so the surprisingly cheap build quality was embarrassing as well as disappointing. In the future, I'll look elsewhere for a nicer umbrella, or at least save money and buy a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the rationale behind the poor quality. I have written to Blunt USA and ...
customer_reviews.text: The shaft snapped off. A board feel on it as it was lying open on the floor but the shaft is made of light weight plastic. If it had been aluminum or some other metal it would have been durable. So is it really worth the price if it is that fragile. Cheap $10 umbrellas have a steel handle. I don't understand the rationale behind the poor quality. I have written to Blunt USA and asked them to replace the item and have not heard back yet. I don't know if it even matters. Buyer beware and bear the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE! Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's rugged for sure, looks great! But the radius when deployed is super small. I still get wet on a rainy windy day. This would rate as a small, made for a toddler. I was wish they had a Large one, made for an adult. I'd buy that one! UPDATE! Gave one less star. After one month of use, the umbrella is extremely rickety and wobbly. It feels cheap and looks like a toy. Very sad with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CaliberCable

customer_reviews.title: Need both hands to close it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty and fancy umbrella. Handle must be improved as with heavy wind, it turns the umbrella to be difficult to hold. It would be great if it could be closed with a button, so entering to a car in the parking lot while raining is not that difficult as you need both hands to close it. Also, the shape of the umbrella at this size does not protect as expected. Impression is that a regular umbrella, circular, offers better protection.
customer_reviews.author: OldFashionReader

customer_reviews.title: At $25 a rainstorm, not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: For $50, I wold expect it to last more than two rain storms. I live in the NYC metro area, so we generally don't get horrible storms either, but this thing died after just too storms. It sure looks pretty in the umbrella graveyard though. I would definately not buy again. I have gotten a nice wind-proof one from Totes before, but can't seem to find it now. I need to find a new one though, so the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent for a quality umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Best money spent for a quality umbrella. Have used it in very windy weather without any issues. I was with several friends who were using standard run-of-the-mill cheap umbrellas which all flipped inside out and broke. This umbrella didn’t even show any signs of possible strain. Ended up buying a second one so my husband had one too.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect umbrella for city living!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely windproof! Perfect umbrella for city living. It gets extremely windy where I live, and I've typically gone through 2 umbrellas a year. They typically break in the first 5 uses, but I had gotten used to dealing with a damaged umbrella until it was absolutely dead. However, I've had this umbrella through two blizzard-heavy winters, rainy springs and gusty autumns and can confirm that it is the best umbrella for city living. It flipped exactly once (when a hurricane was coming in, to be fair) without any lasting damage. On days when ordinarily I'd be struggling to keep the umbrella from flipping or just struggling to walk through the heavy winds, this umbrella doesn't even feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wade

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Just too small.
customer_reviews.text: This Umbrella is amazing. It’s well made, with metal and nice plastics and would probably last for years. Unfortunately, it is extremely small. I honestly have no idea how any normal sized person could use this without get wet everywhere but their head. Maybe this would be nice for a child, but the instructions say to not let children use it due to the spring mechanism. I honestly don’t know who this is meant for, just spend the extra 10 for the Classic size or 30 more for the XL
customer_reviews.author: Richard Amador

customer_reviews.title: My review is blunt and to the point
customer_reviews.text: This is a great umbrella. Here we have high winds which sometimes having an umbrella open is useless. Blunt holds up. A little heavy but if I am attacked, I will blunt my attacker and hope they get the blunt point and leave me alone. For self defense and against rain, I will be really blunt and say this is a GREAT product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Dries very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most about this umbrella is that water is easily shaken off before I close the umbrella. I’ve never had this happen before with umbrellas. With a little twirling and opening and closing, almost 100% dry.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Magolske

customer_reviews.title: After just one use, the zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella appears structurally sound, but the umbrella cover and zipper attachment are poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Lu Romje

customer_reviews.title: Flipped
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'1 and 190lbs and it was too small for me. It also flipped upside down on me in my first use! I got soaked in the rain...
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Santelices

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: On my second use this high priced nightmare flipped inside out in the wind and ruined a new hair cut & color. I was so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I probably have 5 Blunt umbrellas. I love that they are super lightweight and durable and have no pointed ends. More importantly, I have not had one break on me yet! Call me crazy, but I let my 5 y/o use this for school because it's easy to carry (and stash in his bag) and very easy for him to put up and take down without pinching his fingers. I suppose that is the real test of durability because my son has been using this for almost 4 months and he hasn't broken it yet!
customer_reviews.author: K. Noble

customer_reviews.title: It's funny, the little things that can help support a ...
customer_reviews.text: It's funny, the little things that can help support a long term relationship. When my wife mentioned that her current umbrella (inexpensive keep in the car type) had finally broke down, I looked for a better, more reliable umbrella with cost not being the primary focus. Reviews on-line narrowed the search to a few brands, all of which seemed to fit my criteria, but the Blunt XS really appealed to me because of its strength, durability, extra protection on the nubs when many of my failed umbrellas disintegrated ends, and the reports from other users. Besides, after 46 years of marriage, I do know her favorite color. She was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: larrytiphone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: Great urban umbrella that wants something robust. After going through 3 small urban commuter like umbrellas, I decided to invest in a expensive but high quality one. I love this umbrella and carry with me daily. The size of this umbrella when folded is approximately the size of your arm. It is not that small but long enough to be functional and be able to carried in a briefcase or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Shin0bi1

customer_reviews.title: Stay Dry
customer_reviews.text: I like Blunt umbrellas. This XS seems long (it does not have a super-compact folding scheme. However, it opens up to a good size (37 inches). On a recent trip to Boston, it kept me dry, but allowed me to maneuver crowded streets. And, with the blunt corners, you don't worry about blinding or skewering your fellow street denizens. The umbrella dries quickly and comes with a thin, but strong, carrying case. I have found that very strong wins wan cause it to invert, but that is under gusts that umbrella can withstand. This is a fantastic travelling umbrella
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Shaft abnormally rotates freely
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella arrived with the shaft being able to rotate 360 degrees. Had to return it. Apprehensive about buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction, Barely Big Enough for One Person In Steady Rain
customer_reviews.text: Durability-wise, this is a solid umbrella. However, no matter what you might picture in your head, based on the photo and description, trust me, when I say, this umbrella will be smaller than you think. It is just *barely* enough for one person, and only if it isn't a hard rain.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: favorite umbrella
customer_reviews.text: For 30 years I've traveled short distances for work, constantly driving here and there. I need an umbrella. I've gone through 5 or 6 umbrellas a year, for years... I lose them, forget about them, they break on me, and I figure a few of them find their way into someone else's hands. So including umbrellas from college days, I'd guess I've been through a couple of hundred. The Blunt Metro IS my FAVORITE. Sturdy, ergonomic, well designed, functional, elegant.... I really like this umbrella. I like using it... I like it so much that it helps me remember to keep track of it. I've given 3 as gifts...
customer_reviews.author: Frank Wakefield II

customer_reviews.title: Small compared to most umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Durable umbrella with a great carrying case. For a small umbrella, it’s compression size is quite large and heavier than most though. The biggest downside to this umbrella is the open umbrella diameter is very small - compared to other small umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but does not protect you from the rain
customer_reviews.text: Zero protection from the rain. I was completely drenched. The only part of my body that was not soaked was the head.
customer_reviews.author: Pri

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchase price
customer_reviews.text: For the money that I spent buying this umbrella ☔️ This umbrella 🌂 wasn’t made as well as I hoped it would be. It’s not worth $50 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Surrosh

customer_reviews.title: excited to test it on super typhoon here in Manila
customer_reviews.text: was really looking forward for this product; really glad that Amazon is able to sip to Manila for this product; it is well made and light; canopy is small than my expectation but is a good size for me; we have super typhoons here in Manila so will be excited how it fairs with rains and wind 200kph... all in all a great buy.... Blunt should open a branch here in Manila as we really need study well made umbrellas especially during typhoon season...
customer_reviews.author: gilbert r.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, not perfect, but Nice
customer_reviews.text: The "mint green" is actually a lovely shade of Aqua, which is what I had hoped. Nice that it has the pointy-things concealed. The 2 down-sides are, as other people have mentioned, the overall size is a bit too small, but I'm not a big person, so it's ok for me. The main reason I chose this was to not have it turn inside-out during heavy, windy storms. It HAS turned inside-out a couple of times, but not as much as my last umbrella did.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Smaller than I expected but not a bad thing. When retracted it’s a big long, so it’s not very compact to store in a bag. Have yet to test it in extremely high winds but seems like it’ll do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Li

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made, But Significant Shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella is well-constructed and feels worth the price from that standpoint, but it has two significant negatives. First, while light, it is fairly bulky when folded. Second, and most importantly, the canopy is just too small to be effective. The bottom of my trousers get absolutely soaked while walking even a block in a light rain. I don't want a portable golf umbrella, but I do want something that keeps more than my shoulders dry.
customer_reviews.author: W. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Their product has really only gotten better in the intervening years since I bought my original ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Blunt umbrella for a couple of years that my kids broke. I ordered this one as a replacement. Their product has really only gotten better in the intervening years since I bought my original umbrella. Sturdy, nicely made umbrellas are hard to find, but this one lives up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Beers

customer_reviews.title: Great design...but smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: It's an umbrella: so as far as keeping water off, it works great. The 'blunt' part of the design is nice too...not having to worry about poking someones eye out. However, it is smaller than I would have liked (even after I read the dimensions). We'll still use it because it is compact and because we like the design, but I'll be looking for something bigger....
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Wanna take a shower in a downpour, get the Blunt SX_Metro Umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella wouldn't keep a mink dry in a downpour on a windless day. Its canopy is way too small and way too shallow to be even remotely effective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Small in size
customer_reviews.text: Overall the build quality is top notch, Useful for getting in and out of the car in a pinch. Do not expect to stroll during a storm with this thing as the size will surely leave you soaking afterwards. I am 6'3" 220 lbs so that may make a difference in coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriopartyof4

customer_reviews.title: Super light
customer_reviews.text: Canopy is kinda smaller than I thought. It might not be the best for the super heavy rain that comes at you.
customer_reviews.author: AMU

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdiest I've owned. It got turned inside out during 30 mph winds, and seems no worse for the experience. The bright color also makes me feel safer. I have not actually traveled with it, but the case seems equally durable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight umbrella, can handle seriously windy weather!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this umbrella for a few months and I would 100% order another one. It's lightweight enough for me to carry comfortably in my bag during my commute, it opens easily with the button, and water rolls right off so that it dries quickly. I live in a really windy area, and my umbrella has stood up to the weather just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Was thinking XS_Metro meant "Extra Small" and good for travel....not this time!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and with a masterful design - I'm sure well get good use out of this umbrella. But XS_Metro? I assumed that meant "Extra Small" and thought it might fit in a hand bag for my wife. No such thing! If the XS does indeed mean "Extra Small" someone has an inflated sense of sizes! I have a golf umbrella that collapses to be as small as this does.....
customer_reviews.author: K. Z. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: ... umbrella thrown away accidently and even though it looked terrible it was a great little umbrella withstanding heavy winds
customer_reviews.text: I had a really old umbrella thrown away accidently and even though it looked terrible it was a great little umbrella withstanding heavy winds. I researched some smaller umbrellas and decided to treat myself to a more expensive one and took a chance on the XS yellow Blunt Metro Umbrella and couldn't be more pleased at how pretty and well made it is. I don't like big umbrellas since I live in a urban area where people are densely packed and moving around with a large umbrella is awkward. I isn't super compact but very light in weight and is just very handsome. I haven't tested it in the rain yet but it looks very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Red Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Flips inside out in strong winds.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Mechanism for opening/closing hides in the handle and is more robust that the standard metal tooth that is used on most umbrellas. Unfortunately, it flips inside out in strong winds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love. Repeat purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased. Bought one for my son and always wanted to borrow it, so... Lasts and lasts, unlike the cheaper umbrellas. Great quality. Nice workmanship and unexpected details make it feel special.
customer_reviews.author: doniAnonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works for maybe just a small day pack, or no pack at all, anything bigger and its going to get wet
customer_reviews.text: I am only 5'10" and the canopy can only really cover the top of my backpack, otherwise its a great umbrella for stuffing in the side pocket. the cover is also a great addition, being probably one of the only umbrella covers that work.
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but small
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet. Smaller than I expected and the color, "charcoal," looks more green than gray. Edited: have used a few times. Good and sturdy but is small so doesn't cover a backpack
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The best umbrella I have ever owned. A colleague turned me onto this brand; he raved about it and he was right. Blunt far surpasses others I have used over the years. Sturdy and easy to stow in the small size. For urban use it is the perfect size. And importantly, no more worrying about the wind blowing an umbrella apart and lasting only a few uses. Great color choices, too.
customer_reviews.author: NYC-SF reader

customer_reviews.title: Awesome umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: Love this umbrella; it really is tough stuff. I couldn't ask for a better umbrella. I only wish it had a bigger canopy but it's perfect for a single person.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting. The top part of the umbrella broke off in only a few weeks of use. Far from being durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jwi28189

customer_reviews.title: Big for an XS
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella, sturdy, great color selection but it's not extra small in size and is heavy. If you want compact, light, and easy to take everywhere this is not the umbrella for you. I'd say this is more standard to large size when folded down, and heavy - because it's very well made. I don't regret the purchase, but I will be buying another (different) umbrella for carrying around in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coles

customer_reviews.title: Good for price. Great build.
customer_reviews.text: I found out about Blunt through Touch of Modern and haven't found a better umbrella company yet. Good quality and good build. It is rather small, hence the name, but is good for the city travel with good portability. Highly recommend if you want to buy an umbrella and forget about buying a new one again. It is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Great quality umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Great quality umbrella, solid build, good size for 1 person, not too big. I will buy a couple more. Will never go back to other umbrella brand.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great BLUNT umbrella.
customer_reviews.text: This the second one I brought for my daughter. Because she asked for it. She lives in N.Y city. Gave the first one to her daughter that commutes to school. So she wanted another for herself because she loved it so much. Said it was the best umbrella she has had.
customer_reviews.author: halina d

customer_reviews.title: not for windy areas
customer_reviews.text: Not good as I thought..keeps flipping inside out like any other umbrella. . But stays intact and good to be used again...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Premium Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I live in New York City and I'm a fast walker, so this umbrella has been perfect for quickly darting between people in the rain. I'm also a designer, and I can tell that this umbrella was thoughtfully crafted. The automatic opening button is a nice touch. If you tend to walk around in a group, I would suggest looking for a larger umbrella, as this one will only barely work for two people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend. Buying a larger one for my primary
customer_reviews.text: I got it as a backup umbrella, chose small for size/weight constraints, but it really is too small for an adult male. Not suitable for more than one person. That said, the build quality is SOLID, 10/10 would recommend. Buying a larger one for my primary.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R.

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this umbrella. In a perfect work I'd make it slightly larger but it's a great balance of size, portability and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella so much I bought one for a friend. He always wanted to us mine. Now has his own! Beat umbrella on the market
customer_reviews.author: Jim Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: An ok umbrella, but does not stand up to winds stronger then 20mph
customer_reviews.text: A nice, small umbrella covered with a nice, sturdy material. This umbrella will fold in on itself with a gust of wind, which is disappointing for a $60 umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: owen

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this umbrella because it opens fast without any effort.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abad

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointed on that end
customer_reviews.text: Can't withstand the wind it says it does. Well, unless they mean it doesn't permanently break under the wind force listed. In about 15mph winds the umbrella was getting pushed closed on me. Pretty disappointed on that end. Other than that, it's well built and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This fits much more easily into my man purse
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my gust buster umbrella that ended up busting a rod. This fits much more easily into my man purse. The only downside is that it's got smaller coverage when fully opened but it is sturdy and I don't end up stabbing myself with anything because of the blunted edges.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Must have! I walk 25 min to school and home every day in Seattle rain. Would not leave the house without it. Two super windy days, the umbrella turned inside out. I was immediately able to turn it back and walk home. This is a VERY rare occasion where we had some very high winds. There is NO damage to the umbrella and it stores easily in my backpack. I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: BMAC

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida where it can rain 2-3 times a day in the summer and this umbrella is easy and quick to deploy. I keep it in my bag and never leave home without it. I do wish it was a little larger when open, but it is the XS_Metro. Maybe they'll make a slightly larger compact.
customer_reviews.author: Omar S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent umbrella worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Excellent umbrella, highly recommended. I'm a little sad that my wife lost it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel I Herzog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: went to NYC with this umbrella. It was very cold and windy. I had no troubles!
customer_reviews.author: kvb

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be useful
customer_reviews.text: The Blunt Metro is lightweight and compact, but it fails in its essential purpose: it doesn't keep you dry. Nothing else matters. It's way too small to use in anything more than a light drizzle. I wish I could return mine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reichman

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this umbrella. I love the blunt edges. Since I live in NYC, I don't have to worry about bumping into people on a crowded sidewalk. I wish everyone in NYC had one! It's also light and small enough to fit into my pocketbook. Opening and closing the umbrella is very easy. Though it's more expensive than a drug store umbrella, hopefully it will last a lot longer! I've actually ordered two (one in orange and one in green) - so that I will always have one available.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Best Umbrella ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Umbrella ever. I love the fact that the edges are rounded as to avoid poking anyone's eye out! This size is perfect for carrying around and travelling with (not a pocket umbrella by any means, but it's small enough and works so well it's worth using the extra space in your bag for this).
customer_reviews.author: H. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little small but I’m a big guy so that was to be expected. I keep it in my travel bag for unexpected rain. I keep a Blunt Classic in my Jeep for most of my uses.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Mine Broke
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased three Blunt Umbrellas. This one broke today. I'll get another. I'm not giving up on the brand just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Garrell Herndon

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella you can buy...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, certainly. The best umbrella you can buy on the market today they won't leave you hanging when the wind kicks up? Definitely. The way I see it, you have two choices, buy lots of really cheap umbrellas and pitch them as they fail or, get this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Gila

customer_reviews.title: Cool but small size
customer_reviews.text: Cool design, did not have a chance to test in high wind yet. Diameter is small, I wish it can be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: T.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great in the Wind!
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my wife...she is very happy with the overall size and color, and pleased with it's toughness. Thank You Blunt for a happy new year...for all of us!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Howard

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to give up on a certain brand of umbrellas suffering their quality declines over years. This is a great replacement. It has no threads to unravel at the tips and no metal points to scratch the paint of my car when I'm juggling stuff in and out of the back seat while rain pours down. Only complaint: it features a hook-and-loop (Velcro) fastener rather than a metal snap fastener. The former will wear out; the latter won't.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Nickelson

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality, wish i had earlier
customer_reviews.text: Really quality material of the nylon fabric, very hydrophobic and quick drying.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: All seasons stylish umbrella but you pay what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Aim to use it for UV protection and rainy season with a strong wind but still don't have a chance to test for the wind. Product design is unique, stylish and light. Love the auto-open but it would be perfect if it comes with auto-close. Highly recommended for those who love to carry an umbrella around in their bag as it's perfect for all seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: works but small
customer_reviews.text: more or less child size. heavy duty but small. would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdgirl

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but not compact enough when folded.
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad umvrealla, my biggest gripe is an umbrella with a small radius like this one should be much more compact when folded. When folded, it's almost as big as a regular uumvrealla which is a deal breaker for me. I kept it because it's unique, well constructed, seems pretty tough and functions very well. But it barely fits in the door pocket of my mid sized sedan.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it during several storms this summer. Fits nicely in my backpack and in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: longtermFX

customer_reviews.title: Great Build, Small Size When Open, Overall good umbrella
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Umbrella feels smaller than it actually is. Has so far been good with the wind. Its lack of auto close is kind of a bummer but its construction is top notch. Would have expected it to be a smaller umbrella when closed. Overall good umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Eric Juran

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny works well in rain and wind
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Sturdy, well made, and stylish. I purchased two and plan to buy more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella. This is not an SUV of umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella. This is not an SUV of umbrellas, that covers your entire family plus a collection of neighborhood badgers. There are plenty of golf umbrellas on Amazon if you're looking for that. It's perfectly designed for what it's made for: an urban umbrella that keeps you largely dry, doesn't take up too much airspace, and doesn't have pokey bits that take people's eyes out.
